channel.title: [Dementhium 639] boolean problem

item.title: [Dementhium 639] boolean problem
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Ill help since you tried

public boolean didQuest() {
    if (player.getInventory().contains(14600) || player.getBank().contains(14600) || player.getEquipment().contains(14600) ||
                player.getInventory().contains(14602) || player.getBank().contains(14602) || player.getEquipment().contains(14602) ||
                player.getInventory().contains(14603) || player.getBank().contains(14603) || player.getEquipment().contains(14603) ||
                player.getInventory().contains(14605) || player.getBank().contains(14605) || player.getEquipment().contains(14605)) {
					return true;
				}
			return false;
		}

I would suggest using an array though.

Read full topic

item.title: [Dementhium 639] boolean problem
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:4, topic:425655”]Your trying to convert a boolean to a string. A boolean can only hold two values, true or false.
Try again with another method.[/quote]

I changed to player.getUsername()
but it didn’t work

This is a boolean I can easily make and they work. (yah, yah its crap)

boolean didQuest = player.getInventory().contains(14600) || player.getBank().contains(14600) || player.getEquipment().contains(14600) || player.getInventory().contains(14602) || player.getBank().contains(14602) || player.getEquipment().contains(14602) || player.getInventory().contains(14603) || player.getBank().contains(14603) || player.getEquipment().contains(14603) || player.getInventory().contains(14605) || player.getBank().contains(14605) || player.getEquipment().contains(14605);

Wtf? how is this any different from that
